I apologize for not being clear in my previous response. It's a valid question, and I'll do my best to clarify.

In this story, Pyrrhos was chosen by the gods to build a great tower to save his family and two of every kind of animal from the coming fire. Pyrrhos worked tirelessly to construct the tower, and it was built with great care and attention to detail.

The tower was made from a unique and magical material that was impervious to fire, which Pyrrhos had discovered during his years of study and experimentation. The material was strong and durable, and it was able to withstand the intense heat and flames of the great fire that the gods had sent to cleanse the world.

Pyrrhos had also designed the tower with a complex system of ventilation, which allowed fresh air to circulate and kept the interior of the tower cool and breathable. Additionally, he had stocked the tower with enough food and water to sustain his family and the animals for the duration of the fire.

As the fire raged across the world, Pyrrhos and his family and the animals in the tower watched in awe as the flames licked the tower's walls but were unable to penetrate the magical material. They felt safe and secure inside, knowing that they had been chosen by the gods to survive and start anew.

When the fire had finally subsided, Pyrrhos and his family emerged from the tower, and they saw that the world had been reborn. They released the animals from the tower, and they went out into the world, repopulating the new, clean world that the gods had created.

I hope this clarifies any confusion.
